title: Chinese unicorn Minimax unveils open-source AI models
content: Shanghai-based AI startup MiniMax has released a new family of open-source large language models (LLMs), called MiniMax-01.The launch includes the general-purpose MiniMax-Text-01 model and the multimodal MiniMax-VL-01, which integrates visual capabilities along with text processing.According to benchmark tests shared on MiniMax‚Äôs official WeChat account, the foundational language model aligns with global standards in areas such as mathematics, specialized knowledge, instruction-following, and reducing factual errors.

title: Meta exec aimed to beat GPT-4 in Llama 3, court filing shows
content: Meta executives were focused on rivaling OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-4 during the development of its Llama 3 AI model, according to court filings unsealed on Tuesday, in the lawsuit Kadrey v. Meta.Internal messages from 2023 and 2024 reveal that Meta‚Äôs AI team set GPT-4 as their benchmark, along with Anthropic‚Äôs Claude.Ahmad Al-Dahle, Meta‚Äôs VP of generative AI, emphasized the need to secure significant resources, including 64,000 GPUs, to compete with OpenAI and Anthropic.

title: Nvidia to build AI data center in Israel
content: Nvidia will construct a 10,000-square-meter data center in Israel with a 30-megawatt capacity, among the largest in the country.Scheduled to begin in early 2025, the facility will feature Nvidia‚Äôs Blackwell chip systems and locally developed communication switches.The center aims to support Nvidia‚Äôs engineering teams in developing technologies for communication networks, processors, and AI software.Nvidia‚Äôs presence in Israel grew significantly after acquiring Mellanox in 2020, focusing on high-capacity AI communication systems.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.In 2023, Nvidia launched Israel-1, a supercomputer ranked 34th among the world‚Äôs fastest, highlighting its advanced capabilities.

title: Nvidia-backed Synthesia raises $180m, valuation hits $2.1b
content: Synthesia, Nvidia-backed AI video platform,¬† has raised US$180 million, boosting its valuation to US$2.1 billion.The round led by venture firm NEA, with participation from Atlassian Ventures, World Innovation Lab and PSP Growth.The funding will support product development, security, and compliance, as the company experiences rapid growth since last year‚Äôs US$1 billion valuation.Synthesia recently launched tools for creating AI avatars and screen recording guided by avatars.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.

title: TSMC Q4 profit hits record $11.38b on AI chip demand
content: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) reported a 57% year-on-year increase in net profit for Q4, reaching about¬† NT$374.68 (US$11.38 billion).The results, disclosed on Thursday, was slightly below analysts‚Äô expectations of NT$377.95 billion (US$11.47 billion).As the world‚Äôs largest contract chipmaker, TSMC supplies major tech companies like Apple and Nvidia.The company has seen increased demand for semiconductors used in AI processing during the October to December period, leading to a record quarterly profit.AD. title: Chinese AI chipmaker Cambricon posts first quarterly profit
content: Cambricon Technologies, a Chinese AI company, has announced its first profitable quarter in a stock filing on Tuesday.The firm expects its full-year loss for 2024 to decrease to between 396 million yuan (US$54,01 million) and 484 million yuan (US$66,05 million).The company estimates net profits for the final quarter of 2024 will range from 240 million yuan (US$32,74 million) to 328 million yuan (US$44,74 million).This development follows a loss of 724 million yuan (US$98,75 million) in the first nine months of the year.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Revenues for 2024 are projected to increase by nearly 70%, reaching approximately 1.2 billion yuan (US$163,68 million).Cambricon‚Äôs shares on the Shanghai Stock Exchange‚Äôs Star Market have risen significantly, closing at 695.96 yuan (US$94,93) on Wednesday, compared to 120.80 yuan (US$16,48) a year prior.

title: Israel boost AI chip procurement amid US export curbs
content: Israel‚Äôs Ministry of Defense is increasing its procurement of AI chips due to potential US export restrictions.This information was confirmed by Lieutenant Colonel Elad Dvir, head of the ministry‚Äôs AI branch.These limitations impact AI hardware and software export, raising concerns about Israel‚Äôs security and technological independence.Israel‚Äôs Tier B and Tier D categorization by the US complicates its ability to acquire advanced technologies for AI.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Officials are calling for improved diplomacy with the US and urgent domestic reforms to secure Israel‚Äôs global position in AI and advanced technologies.

title: Israeli hospitality AI startup Reeco raises $15m series A
content: Reeco, a startup focused on AI-driven solutions for the hospitality sector, has raised US$15 million in a series A funding round.This round was led by Aleph VC, with contributions from Net Capital Ventures and Joule Ventures, raising the total funding for the company to US$25 million.The funds will support research and development, customer acquisition, and the expansion of sales and marketing teams.Additionally, Reeco plans to add new features to its procure-to-pay platform, which streamlines procurement by integrating inventory management, vendor preferences, and accounts payable automation into a single system.AD. title: Google adds AI to Workspace, raises prices in 2025
content: Google announced that starting today, all AI features in its Workspace suite‚Äîincluding Gmail, Docs, Sheets, and Meet‚Äîwill no longer incur an additional fee of US$20 per user per month under the Gemini Business plan.These features are now included in standard subscriptions. However, this update comes with a price increase.The cost of Workspace subscriptions will rise by approximately US$2 per user per month, according to Jerry Dischler, Google‚Äôs president of cloud applications.The base subscription price will increase from US$12 to US$14 per month.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Included AI tools consist of email summaries in Gmail, design generators for spreadsheets and videos, an automated meeting note-taker, and writing tools across applications.Users will also have access to the Gemini chatbot.Recent Google developmentsTimeline15-Jan-2025 üì±Google Play faces Indonesia antitrust ruling this monthKPPU to decide on Google‚Äôs monopoly case in Jan 2025Investigation highlights Google Play Billing fees since 202214-Jan-2025 üöóGoogle‚Äôs AI agent enhances voice assist in Mercedes CLAGoogle launches Automotive AI for voice assistance.Mercedes-Benz to integrate it in new CLA model.10-Jan-2025 ‚öñÔ∏èGoogle faces trial over privacy claims after users opt outJudge dismisses Google‚Äôs motion in data lawsuit.Trial set for August 18 over user consent issues.08-Jan-2025 üß†Google DeepMind forms team to improve AI, world modelsDeepMind forms team for world model researchLed by Tim Brooks, focuses on AI environment simulation07-Jan-2025 ‚öñÔ∏èGoogle faces labor complaint over contractors‚Äô union bidNLRB alleges Google is a ‚Äòjoint employer‚ÄôInvestigation into working conditions changes ongoing30-Dec-2024 üöÄGoogle to focus on Gemini AI expansion in 2025Pichai outlines 2025 plans for Gemini expansion.AI progress vital for Google‚Äôs competitive edge.

title: AFP news agency, Mistral AI partner for reliable chatbot content
content: Global news agency Agence France-Presse (AFP) and France‚Äôs Mistral AI have entered a multi-year partnership to enhance the accuracy of Mistral‚Äôs conversational AI assistant, Le Chat.This collaboration allows Le Chat to access AFP‚Äôs daily output of 2,300 news stories in six languages, including French, English, and Spanish.This initiative aims to provide fact-based and up-to-date responses,¬†addressing the rising demand for reliable content and misinformation.The integration is set to launch for Le Chat users in the coming weeks.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.

title: LinkedIn launches free AI tools for jobseekers, recruiters
content: LinkedIn has launched two new AI-driven tools to enhance the job search and recruitment experience, Job Match tool and a recruitment AI agent. Both tools are available for free.The Jobs Match tool gives job seekers feedback on the relevance of job postings, helping them decide whether to apply.Meanwhile, an AI recruitment agent assists small businesses in creating job posts, finding qualified candidates, and sorting applications.These tools were developed using LinkedIn‚Äôs own AI technology and data, aim to address inefficiencies in platform‚Äôs job-seeking and recruitment processes.AD. title: OpenAI unveils phone-only ChatGPT signups in US, India
content: OpenAI has launched a beta feature allowing new ChatGPT users in the US and India to register with just a phone number, removing the requirement for an email address.However, this feature comes with specific limitations.¬†Users who sign up with a phone number cannot upgrade to paid plans, such as ChatGPT Plus or Pro, without email verification.Multi-factor authentication also requires an email, and phone numbers used for account creation cannot be reused.OpenAI has said that there are currently no plans to expand phone number-only signups to other regions.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.This initiative is part of OpenAI‚Äôs effort to expand access to its products.Recent OpenAI developmentsTimeline15-Jan-2025üóìÔ∏èOpenAI launches assistant-like feature to rival Alexa, SiriOpenAI launches ‚ÄòTasks‚Äô for ChatGPT users.The feature suggests reminders based on past chats.14-Jan-2025üí°OpenAI urges action to maintain US AI leadershipOpenAI proposes measures to retain US AI leadershipWarns $175B global funding may shift to China11-Jan-2025üéâOpenAI, Meta, Uber execs set to attend Trump‚Äôs inaugurationTech execs to attend Trump‚Äôs inauguration.Uber co-hosts inauguration party with Elon Musk.11-Jan-2025ü§ñOpenAI considers high-volume production of humanoid robotsOpenAI re-enters robotics with custom sensors.Plans for adaptive, high-volume production robots.06-Jan-2025üí∞OpenAI forecasts $5b loss as $200 ChatGPT Pro strugglesOpenAI CEO reports $5B losses in 2024.Company seeking funding, restructuring, and higher fees.28-Dec-2024üöÄOpenAI plans to shift to public benefit corporationOpenAI shifts to public benefit corporationSeeks $6.6B funding amid investor pressure

title: BlackRock exec Adebayo Ogunlesi joins OpenAI board
content: OpenAI has appointed Adebayo Ogunlesi, a senior managing director at BlackRock, to its board as it shifts to a for-profit model.Ogunlesi is also a founding partner of Global Infrastructure Partners (GIP), which was acquired by BlackRock in 2023 for US$12 billion.In a statement, Ogunlesi emphasized the role of infrastructure investment in the responsible growth of AI technologies.His appointment follows notable changes to OpenAI‚Äôs board in late 2023, which included the brief ousting and reinstatement of chief executive officer Sam Altman.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Ogunlesi also holds board positions at BlackRock, Topgolf Callaway Brands, Kosmos Energy Holdings, and Terminal Investment Ltd.

title: OpenAI launches assistant-like feature to rival Alexa, Siri
content: OpenAI has introduced a beta feature called ‚ÄòTasks‚Äô for ChatGPT, enabling users to schedule reminders and updates.This feature is available immediately for Plus, Team, and Pro users worldwide, starting with the web version.‚ÄòTasks‚Äô lets ChatGPT suggest reminders based on past interactions, which users can accept or decline.The introduction of this feature comes as leading tech companies enhance their virtual assistant capabilities.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Amazon‚Äôs Alexa is undergoing upgrades with generative AI features, while Apple‚Äôs Siri has incorporated ‚ÄúApple Intelligence,‚Äù allowing interaction with ChatGPT through user permissions.

title: ByteDance plans $614m AI center in China
content: ByteDance, the parent company of TikTok and Douyin, plans to invest 4.5 billion yuan (U$614 million) to establish a computing center in Datong, Shanxi province.This facility aims to enhance the company‚Äôs AI operations.The project, approved by the provincial government, will be managed by Volcano Cloud (Datong) Technology, a subsidiary of ByteDance.The center will cover over 205,000 square meters, with six two-story data center buildings and a six-story integrated facility.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.It will house 15,604 server cabinets and 510 network cabinets, designed to support AI operations like training large language models and processing large amounts of data.Recent ByteDance developmentsTimeline09-Jan-2025üì≤ByteDance promotes Lemon8 amid TikTok‚Äôs potential US banByteDance promotes Lemon8 as TikTok alternative.Lemon8 links data transfer, gains 1M daily users.08-Jan-2025üé¨ByteDance launches Melolo app, expands short drama teamByteDance expands with Melolo, a short drama appShort dramas gain popularity, user base hits 576M03-Jan-2025üö´ByteDance denies AI phone partnership with China‚Äôs NubiaByteDance denies AI smartphone partnership rumorsNubia collaboration news stems from social media chatter02-Jan-2025üíºByteDance refutes $7b Nvidia chip claimsByteDance denies $7B Nvidia chip spending rumorsVP clarifies founder not involved in procurement plans31-Dec-2024üìàByteDance named China‚Äôs top tech investor this year: reportByteDance tops China‚Äôs tech investment in 2024Projected to double spending to 160 billion yuan in 202520-Dec-2024üí∞ByteDance cuts AI costs by 85% in China‚Äôs tech raceByteDance cuts genAI model cost by 85%Chinese giants lower prices in AI price war

title: Ytl, Sea launch Malaysia‚Äôs first AI-powered digital bank
content: YTL Digital Bank Berhad, a joint venture between YTL Digital Capital Sdn Bhd and Sea Limited, has received approval from Malaysia‚Äôs Ministry of Finance to operate its next-generation digital bank, Ryt Bank.Ryt Bank, has received approval to commence operations from 20th of December 2024.The bank will use AI to streamline processes, enhance customer experience, and offer features like encryption, biometric verification, and real-time fraud monitoring.Additionally, it will provide PIDM protection of up to 250,000 ringgit (US$55,000) for customer deposits.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Ryt Bank intends to serve Malaysia‚Äôs 15% underserved and underbanked population.Specific details regarding launch phases or timelines beyond the initial rollout have not yet been disclosed.

title: Taiwanese startup MetAI raises $4m seed funding
content: MetAI, a Taiwan-based startup that specializes in AI and 3D simulation technologies, has raised US$4 million in a seed funding round.The funding was provided by Addin Ventures, Kenmec Mechanical Engineering, NVIDIA, Solomon Technology, SparkLabs Taiwan, and Upstream Ventures.The funds will be used for research and development, scaling the engineering team, and entering the US market.MetAI aims to support industries, including semiconductor manufacturing, automated warehousing, and robotics, through its digital twin technology.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.MetAI‚Äôs technology enables rapid creation of simulation-ready digital twins from CAD designs in minutes.This innovation has been effective in its collaboration with Kenmec Mechanical Engineering, reducing simulation time in automated warehouse environments from thousands of hours to three minutes.

title: Saudi firm Halo AI secures $6m for global expansion
content: Halo AI, a Saudi-based company using AI to enhance brand-creator collaboration, has secured US$6 million in seed funding.The round was led by Raed Ventures and Shorooq Partners, with participation from former executives of global giants like Snapchat, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Amazon.The funding will support Halo AI‚Äôs expansion to Dubai and Kuwait, with plans to extend its reach across the Middle East, North Africa, Europe, and North America.

title: Israeli cybersecurity startup raises $36m seed funding
content: Orchid Security has announced a US$36 million seed funding round co-led by Team8 and Intel Capital, with additional investments from Capital One and industry leaders, including Jeff Williams, Dror Davidoff, and Zohar Alon.The company is developing an identity-first security orchestration platform using large language models (LLMs) to manage and secure identity environments for enterprises.Orchid Security is currently working with global enterprises in sectors such as finance, healthcare, manufacturing, and retail.Its customer base includes Fortune 500 companies like Costco and Repsol.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.The newly acquired funds will be used to advance Orchid‚Äôs technology and support its global expansion efforts.

title: Biden signs order for AI data centers, US-made chips
content: United States President Joe Biden has signed an executive order aimed at enhancing domestic AI infrastructure and addressing related national security concerns.The order allows the Department of Defense and the Department of Energy to lease federal lands for the construction of large-scale AI data centers.Developers must fully fund the construction and operation of these facilities while using renewable energy sources to balance their electricity consumption.Organizations leasing the sites are required to purchase a designated amount of US-made semiconductors and pay their workers prevailing wages.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Developers can submit lease proposals once federal agencies finalize the site selections.

title: AWS, General Catalyst advance AI tools to support healthcare
content: Amazon Web Services (AWS) has partnered with venture capital firm General Catalyst to advance AI tools in the healthcare sector.This multi-year collaboration will enable General Catalyst‚Äôs portfolio companies to leverage AWS services for accelerating AI-driven healthcare innovations.Key players in the initiative include Aidoc, specializing in AI for medical imaging, and Commure, focused on automating healthcare workflows, with plans¬†to launch new tools in 2025.The partnership addresses critical challenges in healthcare, such as staff burnout, labor shortages, and financial pressures.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.

title: Trump likely to keep US AI chip export restrictions
content: The Trump administration is expected to continue the recent US restrictions on the export of AI chips, according to National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan.These rules, introduced at the end of President Joe Biden‚Äôs term, aim to limit the sale of advanced AI processors to certain countries, particularly targeting China.Sullivan added that a 120-day comment period will allow the incoming administration to evaluate and possibly alter these regulations.The regulations have also prompted scrutiny from lawmakers, notably Senator Ted Cruz, who is considering legislative action against the measures.AD. title: OpenAI urges action to maintain US AI leadership
content: On Sunday, OpenAI released a document titled ‚ÄúEconomic Blueprint.‚ÄùThe document calls for targeted investment and regulatory measures to ensure the United States retains its leadership in AI, particularly in competition with China.The 15-page blueprint emphasizes the significance of ‚Äúchips, data, and energy‚Äù in advancing AI technology.It warns that US$175 billion in global funding for AI projects could be redirected to initiatives backed by China if the US does not respond promptly.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.The proposal includes recommendations for export controls on AI models to prevent their misuse by adversarial nations.OpenAI raised US$6.6 billion last year and seeks additional funding to enhance its position in the competitive AI landscape.Recent OpenAI developmentsTimeline11-Jan-2025 ü§ùOpenAI, Meta, Uber execs set to attend Trump‚Äôs inaugurationTech CEOs to attend Trump‚Äôs inauguration on Jan 20Uber to co-host inauguration party with Elon Musk‚Äôs X11-Jan-2025 ü§ñOpenAI considers high-volume production of humanoid robotsOpenAI re-enters robotics with custom sensorsPlans for versatile robots and high-volume production06-Jan-2025 üìâOpenAI forecasts $5b loss as $200 ChatGPT Pro strugglesOpenAI reports $5B losses; seeks funds, raises prices.ChatGPT Pro subscription costs $200, below expected profits.28-Dec-2024 ü§ñOpenAI plans to shift to public benefit corporationOpenAI to become a public benefit corporation.Facing $6.6 billion fundraising and investor profit limits.24-Dec-2024 üìàOpenAI‚Äôs new model shows favorable results, but faces high costsOpenAI‚Äôs o3 model scores 88% on ARC-AGI benchmark.Test-time scaling boosts results but raises costs.22-Dec-2024 ü§ñOpenAI unveils AI model for advanced reasoningOpenAI unveils new AI model o3 for complex tasksSafety measures involve researchers in pre-launch evaluations

title: TSMC Q4 profit set to surge 58% on strong AI chip demand

title: PUBG maker Krafton to invest $136m in game studios
content: Krafton Inc., the South Korean developer of PUBG: Battlegrounds, will invest over 200 billion won (US$136 million) in 2025 to support more than a dozen gaming studios.This initiative is part of Krafton‚Äôs strategy to expand its portfolio and global presence.CEO Kim Changhan revealed that the company has invested around US$680 million in studio acquisitions and minority stakes in gaming startups in Texas and Tokyo over the past two years.Recent Krafton developmentsTimeline29-Oct-2024üåèKrafton backs IMM‚Äôs fund focused on IndiaKrafton partners with IMM Investment for India fundAims at Series A startups in various sectors10-Aug-2023üéÆIn 50 Words: Krafton to invest $150m in Indian gaming, entertainment startupsKrafton to invest $150M in India gaming startupsInvestment follows trial grant for Battlegrounds Mobile India10-Mar-2022üéÆKrafton-backed üáÆüá≥ game streaming firm raises $42mLoco raises $42M in Series A funding roundPlans to expand Indian gaming ecosystem and streaming11-Feb-2022üéÆKrafton CEO backs $3m round of Vietnamese NFT gameSummoners Arena secures $3M from investors.Game combines F2P and POE versions using NFTs.28-Jun-2021üéÆPUBG maker Krafton joins $9m round of YouTube‚Äôs game-streaming rival in IndiaLoco raises $9M to enhance gaming platform10x growth in streamers over the past year19-Jan-2021üéÆPUBG maker Krafton mulls potential IPO this year, report saysKrafton plans IPO, could raise billionsNew games, shows, and acquisitions in the works

title: Microsoft forms new engineering group to boost AI tools
content: Microsoft has announced the establishment of CoreAI ‚Äì Platform and Tools, a new engineering group focused on developing AI platforms and tools.The team will be led by Jay Parikh, previously an engineering chief at Meta and now an executive vice president at Microsoft.This is the first major organizational change at Microsoft since Parikh joined the company in October 2024.CoreAI combines Microsoft‚Äôs Developer Division (Dev Div), AI platform teams, and members of the Office of the CTO.AD. title: US tightens AI chip exports, targets China
content: The US announced new regulations on Monday, tightening the export of AI chips and technology.The move aims to maintain US leadership in the AI sector by imposing export caps on around 120 countries, with exemptions for 18 allied nations, including Japan, the UK, and the Netherlands.These updated rules limit access to advanced computing technology for countries like China, Russia, Iran, North Korea, and include licensing requirements for advanced graphics processing units (GPUs) used in AI trainingThese measures will take effect in 120 days.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.

title: Indonesian AI character generator nets $5m seed
content: Bythen, an Indonesian AI platform focused on creating digital characters, has secured US$5 million in seed funding.The funding round was led by Japan‚Äôs Vector Inc. and Skystar Capital, with contributions from East Ventures, Beenext, Osk, AppWorks, and angel investors such as Tokopedia‚Äôs co-founder William Tanuwijaya and Pinkfong Company‚Äôs co-founder Ryan Lee.The company plans to use the funding for a global launch aiming to onboard 15,000 virtual influencers in the Web3 and gaming sectors.Established in 2024, Bythen allows users to create personalized digital characters called ‚ÄúBytes.‚ÄùAD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.

title: Google‚Äôs AI agent enhances voice assist in Mercedes CLA
content: Google Cloud has announced the launch of the Automotive AI Agent, a generative AI-based solution designed to improve voice assistance in vehicles.Mercedes-Benz plans to integrate the Automotive AI Agent into its MBUX Virtual Assistant for the new CLA model later this year.This integration will include features such as real-time information from Google Maps, support for multi-turn dialogue, and the ability to recall previous conversations.This technology, developed using the Gemini model with Vertex AI, aims to offer more personalized interactions than traditional in-car voice systems.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.The Automotive AI Agent features multimodal reasoning and supports multiple languages, facilitating natural and detailed interactions.For example, it can respond to inquiries such as, ‚ÄúIs there an Italian restaurant nearby?‚Äù and follow up with answers like, ‚ÄúDoes the restaurant have good reviews?‚Äù or ‚ÄúWhat is the most popular dish there?‚ÄùRecent Google developmentsTimeline10-Jan-2025 ‚öñÔ∏èGoogle faces trial over privacy claims after users opt outJudge dismisses Google‚Äôs motion in data lawsuit.Trial scheduled for August 18, 2025.08-Jan-2025 ü§ñGoogle DeepMind forms team to improve AI, world modelsGoogle DeepMind forms team for world modelsLed by Tim Brooks, aims for AGI advancements07-Jan-2025 ‚öñÔ∏èGoogle faces labor complaint over contractors‚Äô union bidGoogle faces complaint as ‚Äòjoint employer‚Äô of 50 workersNLRB investigates altered conditions without prior talks30-Dec-2024 üöÄGoogle to focus on Gemini AI expansion in 2025Google plans to expand Gemini for consumers.Sundar Pichai stresses 2025 as a critical year.25-Dec-2024 ü§ñGoogle tests Gemini AI against Anthropic‚Äôs ClaudeGoogle tests Gemini AI against Anthropic‚Äôs ClaudeClaude shows stricter safety, Gemini flagged for violations23-Dec-2024 ‚öñÔ∏èGoogle to challenge Japan‚Äôs FTC antitrust allegationsGoogle faces FTC allegations of antitrust practices.Company to present its defense at upcoming hearing.

title: Adobe launches new AI tool for bulk image editing
content: Adobe has introduced generative AI tools aimed at automating tasks like image editing and video translation.A key feature is ‚ÄúFirefly Bulk Create,‚Äù which can resize or alter up to 10,000 images in a single operation.Currently in beta, Firefly Bulk Create includes two main tools: ‚ÄúRemove Background‚Äù and ‚ÄúResize,‚Äù both accessible through Adobe‚Äôs Firefly web app.The ‚ÄúRemove Background‚Äù tool allows users to delete or replace image backgrounds, with uploads supported from sources like Dropbox or Adobe Experience Manager.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.The ‚ÄúResize‚Äù tool provides preset dimensions for social media platforms, including TikTok, Instagram, and Facebook.It adjusts image backgrounds to fit specific sizes using generative AI.Recent Adobe developmentsTimeline14-Jun-2023 üé®In 50 Words: Adobe introduces generative recolor AI featureAdobe launches beta Generative Recolor toolSpeeds up color scheme experimentation in Illustrator11-May-2023 üåèAdobe acquisition target Figma launches new hub in SingaporeFigma opens Asia-Pacific hub in SingaporeAims to tap into Southeast Asia‚Äôs tech scene14-Nov-2016 üé®From Adobe‚Äôs design head: 5 tips every designer and founder should knowAdobe enhances design tools for UX designersNew Adobe XD tool launching for Windows in January16-Nov-2011 üõíAdobe Opens an Online Store in China, Tries to Not Think About PiracyAdobe launches first online store in ChinaTargets enterprise users amid piracy challenges03-Jun-2011 ‚ö†Ô∏èHow a Malicious Adobe Flash File Caused the China Gmail Hack [VIDEO]Gmail hack uses Flash to forward emails secretlyMalicious file exploits Adobe vulnerability for snooping17-May-2011 üé®Adobe Shares Creative Suite 5.5 Tips in Philippines, Malaysia and SinagaporeAdobe showcases CS5.5 across Southeast AsiaHTML5 and CSS3 talks highlight web development

title: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek launches free iOS app
content: DeepSeek Inc., a Chinese startup, launched its DeepSeek app on Monday.The app is currently available only on iOS and allows users to interact with various AI models free of charge.The DeepSeek app offers functionalities such as online search and advanced problem-solving through its open-source DeepSeek-V3 model.It supports tasks including conversations, language translation, creative writing, programming, and travel planning.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.The app has received attention for its range of features and accessibility.An Android version is under development, although no release date has been provided.Recent DeepSeek developmentsTimeline13-Jan-2025 üß†China‚Äôs DeepSeek relies on young team to challenge US giantsDeepSeek launches third-gen model, V3.Competes with major US AI firms with fewer resources.27-Dec-2024 ü§ñChinese AI firm DeepSeek unveils model surpassing GPT-4DeepSeek V3 launched with 671B parametersOutperforms models like GPT-4 in key tasks17-Dec-2024 üöÄChinese AI models like Alibaba‚Äôs Qwen rival OpenAI, MetaChina‚Äôs LLMs rival US models like OpenAIUS chip restrictions hinder progress, spurring alternatives

title: South Korea boosts AI, semiconductor ties with Israel, Japan
content: South Korea‚Äôs Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy is seeking to enhance technological cooperation with Israel and Japan, focusing on AI and semiconductors.On Monday, Je Kyung-hee, Director General for Technology Policy, conducted a virtual meeting with Alon Stopel, Israel‚Äôs chief scientist at the innovation ministry.They reviewed progress in joint research projects under the Korea-Israel Industrial R&D Foundation, established in 2001.This foundation allocates US$8 million annually to support collaborative projects and is currently funding 16 projects, with seven more planned for this year.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.In a separate meeting in Seoul, Je met with Jingo Kikukawa, Japan‚Äôs Director General for Innovation and Environment at the industry ministry.Their discussions centered on the importance of bilateral cooperation in adapting to evolving industrial technologies.

title: SK Telecom launches GPUaaS for South Korea‚Äôs AI data center
content: SK Telecom (SKT) has launched its GPU-as-a-Service (GPUaaS) at its AI Data Center in Gasan, Seoul.This on-demand AI cloud service allows businesses to select GPUs based on specific requirements.It offers configurable packages that include standalone servers, firewalls, and dedicated lines.Pricing for GPUaaS will depend on the contract duration, number of GPUs, and payment method.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Initially available with Nvidia H100 Tensor Core GPUs, SKT plans to integrate Nvidia H200 Tensor Core GPUs in the first quarter of 2025.Recent SK Telecom developmentsTimeline10-Jan-2025 ü§ùSK Telecom, SK hynix, Penguin partner on AI data centersSK Telecom, SK hynix, Penguin Solutions team up.Plan to develop AI data center solutions globally.09-Jan-2025 ü§ñSK Telecom to launch AI agent Aster beta in MarchSK Telecom beta launches AI agent Aster in 2025.Aster aims to assist with daily tasks and decisions.13-Dec-2024 üìàSK Telecom invests $3m in AI video analysis startupSK Telecom invests $3M in AI startup Twelve LabsFocus on enhancing multimodal AI capabilities19-Nov-2024 ü§ñSK Telecom completes trial of AI customer serviceSK Telecom trials AI customer service systemFeatures multimodal models for enhanced support06-Nov-2024 üåêSK Telecom plans AI hub for Asia-PacificSK Telecom plans AI data center in Asia-PacificHyperscale center to have 100MW power capacity09-Feb-2014 üéÆSK Telecom T1 has found its new support player: CasperSK Telecom T1 signs new support player Casper.Poohmandu takes a break for health reasons.

title: YouTubers sell unused video footage to AI firms
content: Digital content creators on platforms like YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok are now licensing their unused video footage to AI companies, such as Open AI and Google, for model training.These companies reportedly pay thousands of dollars for exclusive, unpublished content, with rates ranging from US$1 to US$4 per minute depending on factors like 4K quality or specialty formats.AI developers require millions of hours of unique video data to train tools such AS AI video generators that produce realistic videos from text prompts.This practice addresses ethical concerns over unauthorized use of copyrighted material, which has led to lawsuits against firms like OpenAI and Meta.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.

title: Singtel launches Perplexity Pro AI with free year access
content: Singtel has launched Perplexity Pro, an AI search service, in response to the growing demand for AI tools.The service, valued at approximately S$270 (US$198,46), will be available as a one-year free subscription for Singtel‚Äôs broadband, TV, and mobile customers through an activation code in the My Singtel App.Perplexity Pro aims to provide concise answers in conversational language with in-line citations to help reduce information overload often associated with traditional search engines.It includes AI models from providers such as OpenAI and Anthropic, along with Singtel‚Äôs proprietary language models.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Targeting users such as working professionals and students, Perplexity Pro supports multiple languages, including English, Simplified Chinese, and Spanish.Recent Singtel developmentsTimeline05-Nov-2024 üõ°Ô∏èSingtel allegedly breached by China-sponsored groupSingtel faced cyberattack linked to China.No data exfiltrated; malware dealt with.24-Oct-2024 üíºSingtel to sell Dash mobile wallet to Western UnionSingtel sells Dash mobile wallet to Western UnionDeal awaits regulatory approval; operations continue19-Mar-2024 üöÄSingtel to launch Nvidia-powered cloud computing offeringSingtel to launch GPUaaS in Q3 2024New platform Paragon-S enhances satellite operations14-Feb-2024 üöÄSingtel Innov8 sells entire stake in Vizzio to embattled founderSingtel Innov8 sells all shares in VizzioFounder Jon Lee assumes S$1M share capital burden31-Jan-2024 ‚öôÔ∏èSingtel partners with Nvidia, others for AI initiativesSingtel launches Nxera for AI data centers.Partners with Nvidia for enhanced AI capabilities.16-Oct-2012 üì±SingTelSingTel adds 11% in mobile subscribers to 462MCompany invests $364.4M in 7 tech startup acquisitions

title: China‚Äôs DeepSeek relies on young team to challenge US giants
content: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek has focused on recruiting young talent, with many team members being recent graduates or having limited work experience.On December 26, the company launched its third-generation large language model, DeepSeek V3.It is said to compete with AI systems developed by major US companies like OpenAI and Meta, despite being trained with fewer resources.Founded in 2023 and based in Hangzhou, DeepSeek attributes its development to a team of 150 researchers and engineers.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.The team also includes 31 data automation specialists.Recent AI developmentsTimeline10-Jan-2025 üéÆAI-powered Turkish studio Grand Games raises $30m series AGrand Games raises $30M in Series A fundingFunds will expand workforce and game development10-Jan-2025 üî¨AI expert Nie Pengcheng to lead BYD‚Äôs AI R&D centerNie Pengcheng to lead BYD‚Äôs R&D Center.Focus on AI supercomputing and multimodal models.09-Jan-2025 ü§ñAI boosts bank profits but costs 200k jobs worldwide: reportAI may cause 200,000 banking job losses.Productivity boost expected from AI by 2027.09-Jan-2025 üé•AI startup HeyGen integrates OpenAI for talking avatarsHeyGen integrates avatars with OpenAI‚Äôs Sora modelNew tech cuts costs and time for video production09-Jan-2025 üöÄAI jobs top LinkedIn‚Äôs US job growth listAI roles see 59% growth in job postingsAI engineer tops LinkedIn‚Äôs fastest-growing jobs list07-Jan-2025 üìàAI boosts chip stocks as Foxconn posts record revenueFoxconn‚Äôs Q4 revenue hits NT$2.1 trillionStrong demand for AI servers drives growth

title: Chinese firms showcase AI robots, EVs at CES 2025
content: Chinese firms had a significant presence at CES 2025, representing about 25% of the 4,500 exhibitors at the event in Las Vegas.This attendance rate reflects stability compared to 2024 and marks an increase from 493 participants in 2023 due to earlier Covid-19 restrictions.AI technologies were prominently featured, showcasing practical applications across various consumer electronics sectors, including robotics, smart glasses, electric vehicles (EVs), and home appliances.Unitree Robotics, also known as Yushu Technology, showcased its humanoid and quadrupedal robots.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Additionally, other robots with pet-like designs captured attention for their AI capabilities.

title: Alibaba Cloud launches AI tool for faster app development
content: Alibaba Cloud, the cloud computing arm of Alibaba Group, has unveiled Tongyi Lingma, an AI-based coding tool designed to accelerate app development.Powered by Alibaba Cloud‚Äôs Tongyi Qianwen language models, the tool improves coding efficiency by understanding prompts, writing code, and debugging.Tongyi Lingma can potentially complete app development within minutes and supports Microsoft Visual Studio Code and JetBrains‚Äô developer tools, a feature that distinguishes it from competitors.The tool has garnered interest among Chinese programmers, with Shanghai-based software engineer Frank Lin noting its promising features.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.

title: Hyundai partners with Nvidia to advance AI in mobility
content: Hyundai Motor Group unveiled a partnership with Nvidia to integrate AI technologies into its operations at the CES 2025 tech fair in Las Vegas.The collaboration will focus on software-defined vehicles (SDVs), robotics, and manufacturing.Hyundai will adopt Nvidia‚Äôs Omniverse digital twin software to simulate manufacturing facilities, improving production efficiency and quality.Additionally, the Hyundai team will utilize Nvidia‚Äôs Isaac platform to develop AI-driven robots, enhancing their robotics focus, especially after acquiring Boston Dynamics in 2021.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.The AI solutions will also enable advanced software systems for Hyundai vehicles, driving innovation in autonomous driving and SDVs.

title: Ant Group to connect 280k doctors on Haodf healthcare platform
content: Ant Group has announced plans to connect 280,000 doctors on the Haodf healthcare platform that it acquired last year with 800 million healthcare users on its Alipay app.At Haodf‚Äôs annual conference in Shanghai, Ant Group‚Äôs president Cyril Han and Haodf founder Hang Wang also introduced the AI doctor assistant, designed to help doctors manage patient education and medical records efficiently.Ant Group claims it has connected users to services at 3,600 hospitals for over a decade.

title: OpenAI, Meta, Uber execs set to attend Trump‚Äôs inauguration
content: Several tech executives ‚Äì including OpenAI‚Äôs CEO Sam Altman, Greg Brockman, and Kevin Weil ‚Äì plan to attend Donald Trump‚Äôs inauguration on January 20, as the tech sector navigates its relationship with the incoming administration.Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is also expected, although Meta has not issued a public comment.Meanwhile, Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi will participate in related events, with the company co-hosting an inauguration party with Elon Musk‚Äôs X and The Free Press.These developments occur amid potential shifts in the tech sector under Trump‚Äôs second term, with the relationship between Silicon Valley and the former president historically marked by friction over issues like immigration and online content moderation.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.

title: OpenAI considers high-volume production of humanoid robots
content: OpenAI is re-entering the robotics field after previously disbanding its division, with hardware director Caitlin Kalinowski announcing the development of robots featuring custom sensors.Job listings indicate that the team aims to create versatile, adaptive robots for real-world use, integrating custom sensors, AI models, and computational components.Some listings suggest the robots could have limbs, and there are plans for high-volume production, potentially exceeding one million units.OpenAI is also exploring humanoid robots, with companies like X1 and Figure, supported by OpenAI, pursuing similar goals.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.

title: US agencies partially back Musk‚Äôs legal challenge against OpenAI
content: The United States Justice Department and Federal Trade Commission (FTC) backed part of Elon Musk‚Äôs legal argument against OpenAI, raising concerns about board overlaps that could impact competition.Musk‚Äôs lawsuit claims that OpenAI and Microsoft violated antitrust laws due to Reid Hoffman‚Äôs dual role on both boards from 2017 to 2023 and Deannah Templeton‚Äôs non-voting participation in OpenAI‚Äôs board from December 2023 to July 2024.The agencies noted that even if questionable practices cease, defendants must prove they would not recur, though they did not address the legality of OpenAI‚Äôs shift to a for-profit entity.Musk seeks a federal court order to stop OpenAI‚Äôs alleged ‚Äúillegal‚Äù transition, with a hearing scheduled in Oakland, California.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.The FTC is investigating OpenAI‚Äôs operations, including potential misrepresentation and conflicts, while OpenAI has rejected Musk‚Äôs claims, calling them baseless.

title: Microsoft sues group over Azure OpenAI service
content: Microsoft has filed a lawsuit against a group accused of bypassing safety measures in its Azure OpenAI Service, alleging unlawful access through stolen customer credentials and custom software.The company claims the defendants, known as ‚ÄúDoes,‚Äù exploited stolen API keys to generate content violating the service‚Äôs acceptable use policy, enabling a ‚Äúhacking-as-a-service‚Äù scheme via a program called ‚Äúde3u.‚ÄùThis program allowed users to bypass content filtering systems and reverse-engineer security measures.Microsoft discovered the misuse in July 2024 after identifying theft of API keys from US customers.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.In response, Microsoft enhanced its safeguards, obtained a court order to seize a related website, and seeks damages and injunctions.

title: Nvidia raises concerns over Biden‚Äôs reported export restrictions
content: Nvidia has expressed concerns regarding the Biden administration‚Äôs reported plans to implement new export restrictions on AI chips.Vice President Ned Finkle criticized the potential policy, warning it could negatively impact the United States economy and advantage foreign competitors.The proposed restrictions aim to limit AI chip exports to nations deemed adversaries. They also seek to cap the computing power that can be sent to specific countries.These measures are intended to impede military technology advancements, particularly concerning China.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.Finkle said while the policy is presented as a measure against China, its effects would be global.It would influence computer systems and promote alternative technologies.The US Commerce Department and the White House have not yet commented on the proposed restrictions.Recent Nvidia developmentsTimeline09-Jan-2025‚ö°Nvidia unveils breakthrough AI chips at CES 2025Nvidia chips exceed Moore‚Äôs Law predictions.New superchip shows 30-40x faster AI inference.09-Jan-2025üè¢Nvidia eyes Taiwan office expansion: CEO Jensen HuangNvidia plans to expand office in Taiwan.CEO hints at announcement during Computex Taipei.09-Jan-2025üñ•Ô∏èNvidia launches AI computer with MediaTek CPUNvidia launches Project Digits at CES 2025.Features Blackwell AI chip, priced at $3,000.08-Jan-2025ü§ñNvidia-backed Serve Robotics raises $80m for expansionServe Robotics raises $80 million for expansionPlans to increase delivery robots in LA to 35007-Jan-2025ü§ñNvidia debuts RTX GPUs, ‚ÄòAgentic AI‚Äô at CES 2025Nvidia unveils RTX Blackwell GPUs and AI systemsPartnership with Toyota for autonomous vehicle AI07-Jan-2025üéâNvidia stock hits record high ahead of CEO‚Äôs speechNvidia stock hits record high at $149.70CEO Huang to unveil next-gen AI chips at CES

title: TSMC achieves $26.3b in Q4 revenue due to growing AI demand
content: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC), the largest contract chipmaker globally, reported fourth-quarter revenue of NT$868.42 billion (around US$26.3 billion) for the period of October to December 2024.This figure shows a 34.4% increase from the same period in the previous year, primarily due to high demand for chips used in AI.The company had projected fourth-quarter revenue between US$26.1 billion and US$26.9 billion during its earnings call in October.The reported revenue surpasses the LSEG market estimate of NT%$853.57 billion (around US$$25.8 billion).AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.In December alone, TSMC‚Äôs revenue reached NT$278.16 billion, reflecting a significant year-on-year increase of 57.8%. However, the company did not provide further details in its statement.TSMC will release its complete fourth-quarter earnings report and its outlook for the current quarter and full year on January 16.The company‚Äôs stock, which rose by 81% in 2024, remained unchanged during Friday trading.Recent TSMC developmentsTimeline30-Dec-2024üèóÔ∏èTSMC to build two more chip plants in southern TaiwanTSMC to start 4th & 5th plants in 2025.Expansion creates 8,000 jobs in Kaohsiung.24-Dec-2024üìàTSMC hits record high on AI growth, strong salesTSMC shares hit record high, up 1.4% today.Stock up 84% this year, best performance since 1999.23-Dec-2024üìàTSMC US shares hit 25% premium, highest in two monthsTSMC‚Äôs US shares at 25% premium over local ones.US shares rose 1.3%, local shares fell 3.3%.17-Dec-2024ü§ñTSMC explores AI-powered robots, drones for growthTSMC sees potential in multipurpose service robots.Drones identified as another growth opportunity for Taiwan.16-Dec-2024üìàTSMC to boost AI-driven foundry market share to 66% by 2025TSMC‚Äôs market share expected to rise to 66% by 2025.AI demand drives growth in global IC market.10-Dec-2024üìàTSMC‚Äôs November sales up 34% due to strong AI demandTSMC reports 34% sales increase in November.Sales driven by strong AI sector demand.

title: Musk‚Äôs attorney urges OpenAI auction: sources
content: Elon Musk‚Äôs attorney, Marc Toberoff, has urged attorneys general in California and Delaware to push OpenAI to auction off a significant stake in the company, according to sources familiar with the matter.This request aims to assess the fair value of OpenAI‚Äôs charitable assets as the company restructures to separate its for-profit business and non-profit operations.Toberoff emphasized the need for¬†competitive bidding to protect the public‚Äôs interest in OpenAI‚Äôs charitable assets.This request follows OpenAI‚Äôs move to form a public benefit corporation to support fundraising efforts.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.A court decision on Musk‚Äôs request for a preliminary injunction is expected later this month.Recent OpenAI developmentsTimeline06-Jan-2025üìâOpenAI forecasts $5b loss as $200 ChatGPT Pro strugglesOpenAI CEO announces $5B loss projections for 2024Seeking funding, restructuring, and higher subscription fees28-Dec-2024üîÑOpenAI plans to shift to public benefit corporationOpenAI shifts to public benefit corporation.Criticism and lawsuit amid funding needs rise.24-Dec-2024ü§ñOpenAI‚Äôs new model shows favorable results, but faces high costsOpenAI launches o3 model, scoring 88% on ARC-AGI.New test-time scaling increases costs over $10,000/task.22-Dec-2024üöÄOpenAI unveils AI model for advanced reasoningOpenAI unveils new model o3 for complex reasoningSafety measures in place with researcher evaluations17-Dec-2024üöÄOpenAI expands ChatGPT with free AI searchAI search engine now available to all ChatGPT usersImproved mobile experience with detailed search results15-Dec-2024üÜïOpenAI launches ‚ÄòProjects‚Äô feature for task organizationOpenAI launches ‚ÄòProjects‚Äô feature for ChatGPTCurrently for Plus, Pro, Teams; Edu access in 2024

title: Perplexity integrates Tripadvisor to improve hotel searches
content: AI search engine Perplexity has integrated Tripadvisor data to enhance its hotel search feature, allowing users to view organized lists of hotels, complete with ratings, images, and summaries based on Tripadvisor information.Perplexity co-founder Johnny Ho stated that the integration syncs regularly with Tripadvisor to provide reliable results that align with user queries, improving on basic details, such as addresses and user ratings.The updated feature seeks to improve user experience by providing more comprehensive data.Perplexity plans to add recommendations for restaurants and activities in the future.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.The feature is currently available on the web and will soon be accessible on Perplexity‚Äôs mobile app.

title: Meta faces allegations of using pirated books for AI
content: Meta Platforms is facing allegations in California federal court over using pirated books to train its AI systems.These claims were detailed in court documents released on Wednesday.Prominent authors, including Ta-Nehisi Coates and Sarah Silverman, claim that Meta, with CEO Mark Zuckerberg‚Äôs approval, knowingly used the AI dataset LibGen, which contains millions of pirated works.The lawsuit, originally filed in 2023, accuses Meta of copyright infringement for using the authors‚Äô works to train its Llama language model. Meta argues its actions fall under fair use.AD. Remove this ad space byregistering for a free basic account.Enjoy an ad-free experiencewhen you're logged in.The authors seek court approval to file an updated complaint with new evidence, revive dismissed claims related to copyright management, and add an allegation of computer fraud.Meta has yet to respond to the allegations.Recent Meta developmentsTimeline09-Jan-2025üì∞Meta staffers criticize its third-party fact-checking terminationMeta ends third-party fact-checking program.Shift to user-driven approach raises employee concerns.08-Jan-2025üó≥Ô∏èMeta eases political content rules, adds user controlsMeta resumes political content on platformsUsers can customize political content levels08-Jan-2025üó£Ô∏èMeta ends fact-checking, introduces community-based notesMeta ends third-party fact-checking programLaunches user-driven ‚Äòcommunity notes‚Äô initiative08-Jan-2025üìâMeta board adds UFC‚Äôs Dana White, cuts female presenceMeta appoints Dana White, lowering female board rep.Board now includes 10 men and 3 women, 7 billionaires.07-Jan-2025üìàMeta expands board with new strategic appointmentsMeta adds Dana White, Charlie Songhurst, John ElkannFocus on AI and tech innovations for strategic growth18-Dec-2024üîíMeta pays $50m to settle Australia‚Äôs privacy violation caseMeta settles AU privacy case for $50MAccessed data of 300,000 users without consent

title: Healthcare startup Hippocratic AI raises $141m in funding
content: Hippocratic AI announced a valuation of US$1.64 billion following its series B funding round, which raised US$141 million. This brings the company‚Äôs total funding to US$278 million.The round was led by Kleiner Perkins, with existing investors such as Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, Premji Invest, NVIDIA, SV Angel, Universal Health Services, and WellSpan Health.Co-founded by CEO Munjal Shah, Hippocratic AI collaborates with physicians, hospital administrators, and AI researchers from institutions like Johns Hopkins, Stanford, Microsoft, Google, and NVIDIA.
